result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darrel Cortez Smalley

records.addlTxt: Order for County Expensed Investigator, signed and filed.
Forwarded for signature.

Defendant Darrel Cortez Smalley in court.  Attorney Nicole A. Muller in court for Darrel Cortez Smalley.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defense/ requested motion hearing date.  Defense motion to be filed on or before 12-16-2022. State's response to be filed on or before 01-17-2022. Defense request that the court approve $500.00 for investigative services, granted by the Court. Defense to file a proposed order. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Motion hearing scheduled for January 20, 2023 at 10:00 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Darrel Cortez Smalley in court with attorney Nicole A. Muller.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requested adjournment to allow more time to review discovery.  State does not object.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 11.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (15 pages) commencing 05-17-2022 by DANIELLE N. HOLCOMB.

Defendant Darrel Cortez Smalley in court with attorney Nicole A. Muller.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requests more time due to just receiving discovery. Case remains calendared in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 316 of the Safety Building. status hearing is scheduled for 8/11/22 at 8:30 am
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Notice Of Intent To Use DNA Evidence At Trial - received
Case recalled. Court cancelled the imposed, but stayed bench warrant.

Defendant Darrel Cortez Smalley in court, appear in person with attorney Nicole A. Muller, appear in person.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer D. Trester. Court took Judical Notice for case 15CF1488.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated May 16, 2022 - received

Attorney Nicole A. Muller in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. Defendant is not present, having technical issues. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated April 6, 2022 - received
Letter to the Court from defense counsel dated April 5, 2022 - received

Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense

- signed by the Court (electronically)

-  copies to be mailed to the parties
Atty. Muller contacted the court and accepted the appointment
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Darrel Cortez Smalley in court.  Patrick Anderson, appearing for Alexander James Geocaris, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.

Indigency hearing proceeded.  Statements by the Defendant.  Based upon review of the Defendant's statements made in court, the Court finds that the Defendant is indigent and does qualify for representation at the County's expense. Court will appoint counsel for Defendant.  The Court appoints Attorney Nicole Muller to represent defendant at the rate of $100 per hour;  Attorney Muller NOT present in court but will be contacted by the deputy clerk as to the appointment. 

Court ordered Defendant to contribute to legal expenses at a rate of  $100 per month upon conclusion of this case.  All payments should be made directly to the Clerk of Courts Office.  

Court ordered case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Court tolls time limits as to preliminary hearing.

Clerk:  jms
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated March 10, 2022 - received

Defendant Darrel Cortez Smalley in court.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Preliminary Hearing.  Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation and has not hired private counsel.  Court will adjourn case for indigency hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 28.  Indigency hearing scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated February 24, 2022 - received

ADDRESS INFO for Darrel Cortez Smalley
Current: 6124 West Leon Terrace, Milwaukee, WI 53216 United States  (Effective: 02-23-2022)
Prior: 3906 North 71st Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216

Court ordered no contact with D.R.P.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Darrel Cortez Smalley in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Darrel Cortez Smalley in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Darrel Cortez Smalley appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:
